items.title: SlowFast-LLaVA-1.5: A Family of Token-Efficient Video Large Language Models for Long-Form Video Understanding
items.brief:
- **Insight:** Our primary focus is on highly efficient model scales (1B and 3B), demonstrating that even relatively small Video LLMs can achieve state-of-the-art performance on video understanding, meeting the demand for
- **Evidence:** We incorporate the two-stream SlowFast mechanism into a streamlined training pipeline, and perform joint video-image training on a carefully curated data mixture of only publicly available datasets.
- **Actionability:** Prototype this with minimal changes: start by evaluating batching/streaming settings on a single model endpoint and compare latency at p50/p95.

items.title: UICoder: Finetuning Large Language Models to Generate User Interface Code through Automated Feedback
items.brief:
- **Insight:** Our method starts with an existing LLM and iteratively produces improved models by self-generating a large synthetic dataset using an original model, applying automated tools to aggressively filter, score, and de-duplicate the
- **Evidence:** In this paper, we explore the use of automated feedback (compilers and multi-modal models) to guide LLMs to generate high-quality UI code.
- **Actionability:** In this paper, we explore the use of automated feedback (compilers and multi-modal models) to guide LLMs to generate high-quality UI code.

items.title: How to Enhance RAG Pipelines with Reasoning Using NVIDIA Llama Nemotron Models
items.brief: - **Insight:** A key challenge for retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) systems is handling user queries that lack explicit clarity or carry implicit intent. - **Evidence:** Users often... [refs: https://developer-blogs.nvidia.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/FlashInfer-e1749840325535-768x432-jpg.webp"] - **Actionability:** Prototype this with minimal changes: start by evaluating batching/streaming settings on a single model endpoint and compare latency at p50/p95.

items.title: Optimizing LLMs for Performance and Accuracy with Post-Training Quantization
items.brief: - **Insight:** Quantization is a core tool for developers aiming to improve inference performance with minimal overhead. - **Evidence:** It delivers significant gains in latency, throughput,... [refs: https://developer-blogs.nvidia.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/Quantization-768x432-png.webp"] - **Actionability:** Prototype this with minimal changes: start by evaluating quantization or KV-cache tweaks on a single model endpoint and compare latency at p50/p95.

items.title: New Nemotron Nano 2 Open Reasoning Model Tops Leaderboard and Delivers 6x Higher Throughput
items.brief: - **Insight:** Theres a new leaderboard-topping NVIDIA Nemotron Nano 2 model. - **Evidence:** Its an open model with leading accuracy and up to 6x higher throughput compared to the next... (6x) [refs: https://developer-blogs.nvidia.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/QL-nemotron-768x432-png.webp"] - **Actionability:** Prototype this with minimal changes: start by evaluating batching/streaming settings on a single model endpoint and compare latency at p50/p95.

items.title: Introduction to torch.compile and How It Works with vLLM
items.brief:
- **Insight:** [!NOTE] This blog originated from our biweekly vLLM office hours, a community forum hosted by Red Hat with vLLM project committers and the UC Berkeley team.
- **Evidence:** Join us every other Thursday at 2:00 PM ET / 11:00 AM PT on Google Meet, and get the recording and slides afterward on our YouTube playlist.
- **Actionability:** Prototype this with minimal changes: start by evaluating batching/streaming settings on a single model endpoint and compare latency at p50/p95.

items.title: vLLM Now Supports gpt-oss
items.brief:
- **Insight:** Were thrilled to announce that vLLM now supports gpt-oss on NVIDIA Blackwell and Hopper GPUs, as well as AMD MI300x and MI355x GPUs.
- **Evidence:** Were thrilled to announce that vLLM now supports gpt-oss on NVIDIA Blackwell and Hopper GPUs, as well as AMD MI300x and MI355x GPUs. (300x, 355x)
- **Actionability:** Prototype this with minimal changes: start by evaluating batching/streaming settings on a single model endpoint and compare latency at p50/p95.

items.title: Optimal Corpus Aware Training for Neural Machine Translation
items.brief:
- **Insight:** Corpus Aware Training (CAT) leverages valuable corpus metadata during training by injecting corpus information into each training example, and has been found effective in the literature, commonly known as the "tagging" approach.
- **Evidence:** Models trained with CAT inherently learn the quality, domain and nuance between corpora directly from data, and can easily switch to different inference behavior.
- **Actionability:** Models trained with CAT inherently learn the quality, domain and nuance between corpora directly from data, and can easily switch to different inference behavior.
